message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.SP, cs.MM, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the theory of sampling and reconstruction of data, which is a fundamental topic in information theory (cs.IT). The Stable Sampling Rate (SSR) is a key concept in the paper, which is also relevant to signal processing (cs.SP) and image processing (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the use of binary samples, which can be modelled by Walsh functions, and wavelet reconstruction, which are topics in multimedia (cs.MM) and signal processing (cs.SP). Finally, the paper discusses two specific methods, generalized sampling and the Parametrized Background Data Weak (PBDW) method, which are relevant to statistical inference (cs.SI).
